projects_table¶

class tracktor_server.projects_table.Projects(db_name)¶

Bases: object

Class to manage connection to the backend Projects table.

This class provides methods to to write/read from a SQLite database directly, while main.py handles the requests and calls on these functions.

db_name¶

The name of the SQLite database file.

Type:

str

connection¶

The database connection.

Type:

sqlite3.Connection or None

add_project(name, type, status, shotsNum, deadline)¶

Adds a new project to projects table.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the project.

  • type (str) – The type/category of the project.

  • status (str) – The status of the project.

  • shotsNum (int) – The number of shots in the project.

  • deadline (str) – The deadline for the project.

Returns:

The ID of the newly created project.

Return type:

int

get_db()¶

Opens the named database or creates one if it doesn’t exist.

Returns:

The db connection object.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

get_project(project_id)¶

Returns all columns of the chosen project.

Parameters:

project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

Returns:

The project row, or None if not found.

Return type:

sqlite3.Row

get_project_id_by_sharecode(sharecode)¶

Gets the project ID associated with a given share code.

Parameters:

sharecode (str) – The share code of the project.

Returns:

The project ID if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

int or None

get_projects()¶

Gets existing projects from db.

Returns:

A list of all project rows.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

get_sharecode(project_id)¶

Generates and/or returns a sharing code for the project with project_id.

Parameters:

project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

Returns:

The share code for the project.

Return type:

str

init_project_table()¶

Creates an SQL table for projects if it doesn’t already exist.

remove_project(project_id)¶

Deletes a chosen project from project table. Note that idex won’t be reset.

Parameters:

project_id (int) – The ID of the project to remove.

Tracktor VFX
